name: Cairo Marriott Hotel & Omar Khayyam Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose an 'Executive Room', which seems to be a standard room with access to the Executive Lounge. More on that later...
reviews.title: That Executive Lounge is coming with me!

likes.liked: — The Exec Lounge, the service, the cleanliness, the consistency

reviews.text: Room was smaller than I'd expected, but a good-sized balcony with a view over the pool and the Nile to the right. Bed was big, comfy, lots of pillows, the usual Marriott standard. There was only just enough room for the desk, chair and an armchair besides. The bathroom was fairly small, too, but a decent range of Marriott-label toiletries. Very, very average hotel hairdryer. Fluffy white bathrobes, though one disappeared on day two despite it being a double room. Apart from that, the housekeeping was impeccable. Minibar was quite well stocked. The decor is typically elegant and well maintained. The photos on the hotel's website are fairly representative, although they did make this type of room seem bigger than it is. We had very busy days, so weren't up for too much nightlife, but don't count on the TV for entertainment. A thousand channels with quirky local productions of MTV, soaps and Idol, but not much for English-only speakers other than news and a couple of channels running pretty old movies. Remember 'Starman'? Yup...
reviews.title: Enjoyable!

likes.disliked: — Torn wallpaper in the room & bathroom

reviews.text: The room came with access to the Executive Lounge. Have stayed in hotels with this type of concept before, and this one was better in range and quality. Open during the day and evening, guests are welcome to stop in for a light breakfast or dinner, midday drink or snack, use the library and office facilities, all without charge. We loved the Executive Lounge. Great service, great food; drinks, fruit and little cakes at the ready...I want one of these installed in my house, complete with the staff. The Executive Lounge experience (and we experienced it a lot!) absolutely made our stay. You can't help but feel a bit naughty going back for your third visit for the day, but the staff are delightful and seem to welcome you even more warmly the more they see you. We gave in to the guilt and ate at the poolside cafe, too. The food was unfortunately average, but the surroundings were tropical, exotic and divine, so definitely worth doing.
reviews.title: Really Palatial

likes.liked: — The historic wing of the hotel
likes.disliked: — the shopping arcade could have been more interesting

reviews.text: Without exception, the Marriott staff were friendly, helpful and professional. Having stayed here, I wouldn't bother looking for an alternative in Cairo.
reviews.title: This hotel made doing Cairo on our own very nice

likes.disliked: — Overall the restaurants were not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed in Cairo Marriot before renovations and I was very sceptical of re-booking despite my travel agent's assurances that the hotel's rooms are now in an excellent condition. Hotel's main building (lobby and corridors leading to breakfast room) as well as the spectacular gardens were always and remain the highlights of this hotel. Rooms are lovely refurbished however they still can not be described as "luxurious": medium size, comfortable large (2 queen or 1 king) beds, a small desk a table and an armchair. No sleepers or bathrobes, small closet. Bathroom was of decent size and clean but curtain and bath floor were torn. View from the last floor of the west wing was nice but can't be compared to Sofitel (ex Sheraton) or Hyatt.
reviews.title: WOW!

likes.disliked: — Not a true feel of the city

reviews.text: The Marriott hotel located on Zamalek island in the very centre of Cairo consists of two highrise hotel towers (Gezira tower and Zamalek tower), and an old 19th century palace building in the middle, now acting as lobby, casino, meeting rooms, shopping & restaurant area. I think the layout works very well and does justice to the glory of the old palace which is simply gorgeous. In the back of the hotel, within the old palacial garden, there is a wonderful beer garden, an Egyptian restaurant with live music, and of course a pool & spa centre (open 24hrs daily - a major plus in my books!!).
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, great service, pool open 24hrs/day

likes.liked: — 24hrs access to pool & spa, great restaurants & pubs
likes.disliked: — executive lounge & its poor selection of services and beverage offerings

reviews.title: nice hotel, quiet
reviews.text: The hotel services are very good in general and staff is helpful and polite in my experience. My room on 16th floor was very clean and typical of a 5-star hotel, balcony view to the Nile river was beautiful but making me a bit nervous with my fear of heights!

On top of the palace building in the middle there is an open-air sports bar with a massive screen to watch sports from - this was a fabulous feature during UEFA 2008 football cup. Another nice place was Harry's pub, styled like a proper english bar. The pool was large, and part of it was in a shaded area below a roof, good idea in the scorching sun of Egypt. As said, it gains also a huge plus-sign from me for being open 24hrs daily - I wish more hotels would do this, because a business traveler in particular cannot use the pool typically before 6pm earliest.
reviews.title: A good international hotel with a local flavour

likes.disliked: — Service was a bit on the slow side

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing I would criticize in this hotel is the executive lounge and its services: There is no possibility to do checkout from lounge, I tried to do printing there but nobody knew how to get the computer systems to work, and in the lounge if you order any alcoholic drinks they cost you the same amount as if ordered from room service (and are separately brought there). Most 5-star exec lounges I have visited offer a wide selection of beverages, and all are inclusive - i.e. no separate price tag. Food in the lounge was good.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: All in all, Marriott offers a beautiful haven of peaceful surroundings on Zamalek island right in the very heart of Cairo. Well worth the money.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, check in was a disaster
Regal Surroundings!
reviews.text: Cairo Marriott Hotel is located in the Zamalek area in the heart of Cairo. It is a former palace converted to a hotel and has some wonderful public rooms with vaulted mahogany ceilings and marble staircases. It was very secure - vehicles were checked at the entrace to the parking area by guards and a sniffer dog and all packages were scanned when entering the hotel. We were visiting during Ramadan so the hotel was not full and staff were very attentive to tourists.

reviews.title: Abysmal
reviews.text: With nine restaurants one had a variety of meal choices. Our favorite was the Tuscany - served great Italian food and had a very engaging waiter - Omar - who just made you want to return again. Breakfast was included in our room and was offered buffet style with a wide range of foods for one to choose - both European and North American.

reviews.title: Excellent Stay
reviews.text: In addition to a large pool and spa area, the hotel has a shopping arcade where one can shop for Egyptian souvenirs and handicrafts. I was surprized to see people bartering with staff on the prices in the stores. There is also a bank on site - which made it very easy to get Egyptian money, particulary in smaller denominations.

reviews.title: Only just a 5 star!
reviews.text: The hotel has two towers - our room was located in the Zamalek Tower (north tower) and our room faced the Nile. Our requested non-smoking room was odor free. The room was very comfortable, contained two queen size beds, desk, two chairs, dresser and very generous bathroom and closet space. The balcony faced the Nile and we were able to watch the boats cruising the Nile. While the traffic noise could be daunting at certain hours - once the balcony door was closed, the room was very quiet. Housekeeping was very attentive and our room was cleaned promptly each morning. If you are staying during Ramadan, ensure your room is away from any of the bar/lounge areas as they tend to be quite "lively" after sunset/final prayers and open late.

reviews.title: Select another hotel
reviews.text: There is a standard 12% service and 2% tax added to your bill for all charges.
We are world travelers but I am very fussy with my hotels. I looked long and hard for the right place in Cairo because I knew it would need to be a 'haven' from the crazy outside.
reviews.title: Best choice of the lot

reviews.text: We were traveling with our two teenage children and it is a must that our rooms either interconnect or are adjacent to each other. I did send many emails to make sure that this was a priority. When we went to check in they had us booked on the same floor but at different ends of the hotel. I stood my ground and just said it was a must that we had the two rooms together and they were able to accommodate that request without too much hassle.
reviews.title: The art of lying........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff we found to be friendly and had no problems of any kind.
reviews.title: Probably the best option in a city of tired-looking hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the outside this hotel looks nothing special (like most places in Cairo) even the lobby is a bit, ho hum but the grounds are just stunning. They live up to all the rave reviews.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel and great service

reviews.text: Breakfast is served in the lower level of the hotel and is quite special.
reviews.title: Good hotel but not five stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our recent 3 !/2 week trip to Egypt my husband and I stayed at the Cairo Marriott on 3 separate occasions for a total of 8 nights. On each visit we had wonderful tower rooms overlooking the beautiful gardens and pool of this majestic hotel
reviews.title: Felt like a V.I.P.

reviews.text: The staff were exceptionally friendly (especially in Omars Cafe)and professional. The rooms were spacious and comfortable with views of the Nile. The food at the hotel was exceptionally good and very reasonably priced for a hotel of this rating. We were allowed to explore the hotel and enjoy the old world charm it had to offer. The location was good with several interesting shops nearby.
reviews.title: Nice place, incompetent management
Was great
reviews.text: The bottled water at the hotel was a bit expensive but you were able to buy this together with nibbles etc at a nearby service station. I would highly recommend the Marriott to anyone travelling to Cairo.

reviews.title: Excellent 5 star hotel
reviews.text: When we arrived, despite having a voucher from BA Holidays the receptionist claimed that there had been no payment and that we would have to guarantee the whole stay on a credit card. He told us that we would have to phone BA to sort this out. I did this on my mobile - the BA rep was very helpful but angry that the hotel had not done this themselves. He phoned them but when we checked the next day they had not recorded the correction. I had to find the front desk manager and phone BA again on the spot. No apology was offered but at least this manager sorted out our other problem. Our request for a no-smoking room had been ignored and the one we were given reeked. The receptionist claimed there were no rooms available but as soon as the senior manager was on the case, one was magically procured.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All this a shame as the building is beautiful - converted palace - and full of decent restaurants and some helpful shops - very important as our bags were lost by Egyptair for 3 days! It didnt help that the hotel sent them back to the airport when they were dleivered claiming that we were not residents!
reviews.title: An oasis in hectic Cairo!

reviews.text: Did a fair bit of research on hotels in Cairo, and this one seemed to come out on top for me.
reviews.title: Excellent, friendly staff & great hotel

likes.disliked: — The lifts could be a little slow... but that's being really picky

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wasn't disappointed. The hotel was excellent, I was on an "executive" floor in a immaculately furnished room with a very comfortable bed! OK, the bath was a little small - but all I needed was the shower which was good. The room and bathroom were very clean. Executive rooms recommended for one main reason - the lounge you can use. Given the heat in Cairo the complimentary soft drinks in the lounge more than paid for the extra cost + you could have breakfast and a light dinner there inclusive.
reviews.title: Not the best - wouldn't go back
Honeymooned in Egypt, Marriott was exceptional!
reviews.text: The staff were without fail polite, helpful and friendly. The badges they wore ("Yes is the answer, what is the question?") were very corny - but there service was excellent. They arranged an excellent private tour guide for me, and car to/from the hotel - all without any problem or hassle.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself was an oasis of calm in Cairo, and coming back to the pool surrounded by their gardens was a welcome respite from the heat & craziness that is Cairo. Excellent base for a tourist, where I was busy site seeing for 3 days followed by 2 lazy days by the pool.
reviews.title: OK Hotel

likes.liked: — They upgraded the room after a mistake

reviews.text: Highly recommended.
reviews.title: A wonderful experience

likes.liked: — Safe, quiet location in the heart of Cairo

reviews.title: great, central, convenient!
reviews.text: This hotel was totally comfortable and a great refuge from the pollution and chaos of cairo. We had a beautiful room when we first arrived overlooking the river, but when we returned were given an extremely noisy room. However, they were fully booked, and we required nonsmoking so this can be excused. The gardens are very nice, and the atms, banks, shops, etc. were very convenient.

reviews.title: Extraaordinary.
reviews.text: Had three weeks with a lot of fun.and the business was successful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Marriott is a great option in Cairo for business and leisure travel. Its location on Zamalek island puts you within walking distance to many restaurants and shops, so you don't feel isolated - which I sometimes experience in large hotel compounds. Try using the back door through the small parking lot, and you're steps away from 26th July street with tons of options. And of course a taxi ride away from all the sites. As for the hotel itself, the rooms are a bit uninspiring, but very clean and well maintained. Good pool, excellent gym, many food options.
reviews.title: Excellent choice in Cairo

reviews.text: Seriously was close to steal the cushions and the blankets as they were incredible (didn’t do it thought)
reviews.title: Great

reviews.text: I got a Nile view room which was great
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We were here for 6 nights as part of an Egypt tour, so we didn't have any choice in our rooms or locations. However, it could not have been better.
reviews.title: A Great Stay
beautiful old palace
reviews.text: Hotel is beautiful, and has all the perks you could wish for. Outdoor cafes, casino, indoor restaurants, excellent food, and great rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are lovely with sparkling white linens on the bed. The bathroom is ceramic, with nice shampoo, lotion, bath gel, several washcloths, magnify mirror, hair dryer. They didn't miss a thing.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: Each room has a balcony with table and chairs. Views from your room range from parking lot, gardens, or the Nile river. Regardless of view, the hotel rooms are so nice you won't mind.
reviews.title: The best Hotel in Cairo
Nice hotel
reviews.text: They have a small casino with about 20 slots machines and some tables. We only played the slots. I think Egypt has yet to learn that slot machines should pay off once in a while. After 3 visits we decided to keep our money.

aka: Cairo Marriott Hotel And Omar Khayyam Casino
description: Among the premier Cairo, Egypt, hotels, Marriott Cairo Hotel & Omar Khayyam Casino, in the Zamalek area, is the perfect destination for weekend getaways, vacations and business travel. The twin towers of this landmark hotel rise 20 stories high and provide magnificent views of the Nile and six acres of palace gardens
